author: Slidebean
description:
The hacker who breached Obama, Biden, and Elon must now return £4.1M in stolen crypto.

British hacker Joseph O’Connor aka Plug Walk Joe has been ordered to hand over £4.1 million in stolen crypto after hacking 130 major Twitter accounts in 2020, including Obama, Biden, and Elon.

He didn’t work alone: his accomplices were teenagers he met on Call of Duty.

The scam? The classic “send me Bitcoin, I’ll double it” scheme.
He confessed in 2023, went to jail but his crypto sat untouched until now.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: The guy who hacked Obama and Elon? He has to give back £4.1M in crypto

author: Slidebean
description:
WhatsApp accidentally exposed 3.5 billion users.

Researchers from the University of Vienna and SBA Research discovered a flaw in WhatsApp’s “add contact” feature that exposed names and profile photos linked to phone numbers, affecting up to 3.5 billion accounts.

Meta says there’s no evidence of malicious use, though the claim is difficult to verify.

The issue has been patched, but the incident underscores a recurring challenge:
Even small design choices can create massive privacy risks at global scale.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: A WhatsApp vulnerability revealed the identities of 3.5B users
